argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: .T. = The user has clicked an abort button or hyperlink. .F. = No abort button or hyperlink has been clicked.

page.description: Check if an abort button the statusbar has been hit.
page.discussion: The STATUSBAR.ABORT_CHECK() method returns TRUE (.T.) if the user has clicked an abort button or hyperlink on the Status Bar.

section.title: Example
section.description: This example uses the $b syntax in STATUSBAR.PERCENT() to display a "Cancel" button.

section.example: dim total as N dim i as N statusbar.Abort_Reset() total = 10000 FOR i = 1 TO total statusbar.Percent(i,total,"$b{Cancel...} $g Count: $c of $o ($p%)" if statusbar.Abort_Check()then

section.description: This optional message checks to see if the user really wants to abort the operation.
section.example: if ui_msg_box("Notice", "Cancel the operation?", UI_QUESTION_SYMBOL+UI_YES_NO) = UI_YES_SELECTED exit for end if

section.description: If the user did not want to abort, simply reset the abort state.
section.example: statusbar.Abort_Reset() end if ui_yield() next statusbar.clear()

section.description: This example uses the $h syntax in STATUSBAR.PERCENT() to display a "Cancel" hyperlink.

section.example: dim total as N dim i as N statusbar.Abort_Reset() total = 10000 FOR i = 1 TO total statusbar.Percent(i,total,"$g Count: $c of $o ($p%) - $h{Click here to cancel}") if statusbar.Abort_Check()then if ui_msg_box("Notice", "Cancel the operation?", UI_QUESTION_SYMBOL+UI_YES_NO) = UI_YES_SELECTED exit for end if statusbar.Abort_Reset() end if ui_yield() next statusbar.clear()
